data.meta_site_name: Cinespia | Hollywood Forever Cemetery & Movie Palace Film Screenings
data.text:
the Event...

Directed by Francis Ford Coppola (1974, 202 minutes)

Los Angeles Theatre / $25

doors at 7:00 movie at 8:30

One of the most ambitious and brilliantly executed American films, The Godfather II is full of suspense, intrigue, glamour and murder. Written and directed by Francis Ford Coppola, the film stands on its own and is one of the best films of the golden era of filmmaking.

Starring Al Pacino and Robert De Niro, dual stories are set in the worlds of mid-century Cuba and Las Vegas in the 1950s and the old world of Sicily and New York in the early 1900s. The first story tells of the early days of Vito Corleone as he embraces a life of crime and wrests control of the neighborhood from a malicious gangster. The second story is of his son Michael as he leads the Corleones to take over Las Vegas and become the biggest crime family 50 years later. Winner of 6 Academy Awards, join us for the epic movie on the big screen in our city’s most opulent historic movie palaces.

Explore the theatre’s ballroom, fountains, balconies, powder room and nursery on six floors as we transform it into a 1950s Vegas resort with live music, DJs Zach Cowie and Elijah Wood and extras. Dress up 50s glamour for our free themed photo studio and get your portrait taken in the world of The Godfather. With full bars on five stories of the theatre, this is a 21+ event with valid ID. DRESS CODE : Elegant/Formal Attire – Jacket & Tie Encouraged

Get tickets
